On Wednesday 07 August 2002 14:15, Mark Meyers wrote:
> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(ChildATest.class));
> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(ChildBTest.class));

As I understand the original mail this is exactly what he does _not_
want to (have to) do.

A solution to this might be to write a generateSuite method which
accepts a path and scans it (and its subdirectories) using java.io.File
and attempts to add all class files starting with a special name (say
"TestXyz.class" or ends in a suffix ("xyzTest.class") or is placed in a
directory named "Test") or whatever.

Problem: Zou have to use a naming convention (maybe no problem at all)
and find it difficult to coment tests out (i.e. rename them).

Have a look at Junittestmaker
http://sourceforge.net/projects/junittestmaker/
maybe you can find some ideas there.

Robert
